title.narrative: 07-03 DATA AND EVIDENCE

description.narrative: 7.3. By 2021, communities in selected rural districts have the capacity to engage with service providers and elected officials to demand accountability of the delivery of quality social services, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Evaluation, Public Finance And Local Governance, Reducing Child Poverty, Research, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 7. By 2021, Vulnerable children and families benefit from and participate in a strengthened government response to poverty and vulnerability.

sector.narrative: Community engagement, feedback and accountability mechanisms

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)

PF4C: Budget transparency, accountability and participation
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Strengthening integrated administrative systems (such as beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, payments)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 7.3. By 2021, communities in selected rural districts have the capacity to engage with service providers and elected officials todemand accountability of the delivery of quality social services

description.narrative: In 2021, government’s evidence generation efforts which were supported by UNICEF focused particularly on learning about the impact of COVID-19 and recovery needs, the effectiveness of shock response strategies andsituation analysis of children in Zambia. ZamStats hadseveral household surveys and finalised the population and housing census. The evidence base and use of data was strengthened on nutritional status of children and adolescents, ECD, nutrition sensitive social cash transfers, ending child marriage, education for girls and assistive technologies. The secondary analysis of the Zambia Demographic and Health Survey (2018 ZDHS) providedinsights into deprivations; as did the Situation Analysis. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/01/2022
